required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Exposures of the Mother-infant Pair to the Air Pollution of São Paulo
clinical_study.official_title: Longitudinal Study of the Pulmonary Function Testing of Pregnant Women Exposed to Air Pollution in São Paulo

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: A single group of pregnant women who was analyzed in the first and in the third trimesters of pregnancy

detailed_description.textblock: A single group of 120 pregnant women separated in smokers (n = 17) and nonsmokers (n = 103) and first pregnancy (n = 54) or multiparous (n = 66) who underwent pulmonary function test and used the individual passive sampler in the first and third trimesters of pregnancy

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of air pollution in the spirometry of 120 pregnants, evaluated by individual passive samplers in the first (T1) and third (T3) trimesters of pregnancy, using the non-parametric analysis for repeated measures
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the influence of smoking and parity and the results of spirometry of all pregnants exposed to pollution comparing the frequency of events held by Wilcoxon and the Mann Witney test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 year

arm_group.description: Pregnant women performed one spirometry at each trimester of pregnancy

intervention.description: Pregnant woman use the individual passive sampler 15 days before the spirometry test at each trimester

overall_official.affiliation: School of Medicine, University of São Paulo
